SHARED INTERCONNECTION FACILITIES AGREEMENT
BETWEEN
EXELON WEST MEDWAY, LLC, AND EXELON WEST MEDWAY II, LLC,
TABLE OF CONTENTS ARTICLE I DEFINITIONS 5 ARTICLE II CONVEYANCE AND UNDIVIDED INTEREST 8 2.1 Transfer of Shared Facilities 8 2.2 Conveyance; Condition of Property. 9 2.3 Surrender and Assignment 9 ARTICLE III TERM 9 ARTICLE IV INDEMNITY, USE AND COMPLIANCE 10 4.1 Cross Indemnity 10 4.2 Indemnification of Shared Facilities Manager 10 4.3 Indemnification by the Shared Facilities Manager 10 4.4 Limitations on Liability; Waiver of Consequential Damages 10 4.5 Environmental Compliance 10 4.6 No Waste or Nuisance; Maintenance; No Interference. 11 4.7 Liens 11 4.8 Project Controlled Assets Taxes 11 4.9 Insurance 11 ARTICLE V OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT 11 5.1 Interconnection Agreement Requirements 11 5.2 Appointment, Removal and Replacement of Shared Facilities Manager 11 5.3 Maintenance of the Shared Facilities 12 5.4 Performance Standard 12 5.5 Coordination 12 5.6 Disconnection from Shared Facilities 14 5.7 Specific Authority 14 5.8 Limitation on Authority 15 5.9 Market Operations. 16 5.10 No Jurisdictional Service 16 ARTICLE VI SHARED EXPENSES; PAYMENTS; O&M BUDGET 16 6.1 Shared Expenses 16 6.2 Directly Assigned Expenses 17 6.3 Expenses Beyond the Scope of this Agreement 17 6.4 Invoicing, Late Payments 17 6.5 Maintenance of Records 17 6.6 Quarterly Reports 17 6.7 Shared Facilities O&M Budget 17 6.8 Shared Facilities Manager Expenses 18 6.9 Other Expenses Caused By Co-Tenants 18 ARTICLE VII DISPUTE RESOLUTION 18 7.1 Dispute Resolution and Procedures 19 7.2 Notice; Meeting and Confer 19 7.3 Agreement to Arbitrate Disputes 19 7.4 Commencement of Proceedings 19 7.5 Location 19 7.6 Filing Deadlines 19 7.7 Consent to Jurisdiction; Waiver of Jury Trial 20 ARTICLE VIII TRANSFER OF INTERESTS; RIGHT TO ENCUMBER 20 8.1 Transfer 20 8.2 Right to Encumber 20 8.3 Pledge, Collateral Assignment or Encumbrance 20 8.4 Estoppels; Consents; Etc 21 ARTICLE IX DEFAULT AND REMEDIES 21 9.1 Events of Default; Default 21 9.2 Remedies 22 ARTICLE X REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 23 ARTICLE XI GENERAL PROVISIONS 23 11.1 Notices 23 11.2 Third Party Beneficiaries 23 11.3 Amendment 23 11.4 Integration 23 11.5 Severability 24 11.6 Further Assurances; Cooperation 24 11.7 Successors and Assigns 24 11.8 Nature of Relationship Between Co-Tenants 24 11.9 Waiver of Partition 24 11.10 Construction 24 11.11 Waiver 25 11.12 Survival 25 11.13 Counterparts 25
Exhibit A - Shared Facilities
Exhibit B - Bill of Sale
SHARED INTERCONNECTION FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS SHARED INTERCONNECTION FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this "Agreement"), dated as of June , 2016 (the "Execution Date"), is made and entered into by and between EXELON WEST MEDWAY, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("West Medway"), acting in its capacity as a Co-Tenant (as defined in Article I), and EXELON WEST MEDWAY II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("West Medway II"), acting in its capacity as a Co-Tenant (as defined in Article I), and as the Share Facilities Manager (as defined in Article I). RECITALS WHEREAS, West Medway owns and operates an existing approximately 42 MW electric generating facility ("Jet 3") located in Massachusetts in the balancing authority area of ISO New England, Inc. ("Transmission Provider"); and WHEREAS, West Medway II is developing and intends to construct, own and operate an electric generation facility with a projected nameplate capacity of approximately 207 MW (the "West Medway II Project", together with Jet 3, the "Projects" and each a "Project") at a site adjacent to Jet 3; and WHEREAS, in connection with the development of the West Medway II Project, certain electrical facilities will be constructed, including three 115 kV conductors and related infrastructure and equipment as further described in Exhibit A, that will be necessary to interconnect the West Medway II Project, and will be used to interconnect Jet 3, to the transmission grid (the "Shared Facilities"); and WHEREAS, the Co-Tenants desire to share the ownership and use of the Shared Facilities with each Co-Tenant holding an Undivided Interest in such Shared Facilities pursuant to this Agreement; and WHEREAS, no later than the date construction of the West Medway II project commences, West Medway and West Medway II expect to enter into a lease agreement through which West Medway will grant to West Medway II a leasehold interest in the premises on which the Shared Facilities will be located (the "Premises Agreement"); and WHEREAS, each of the Co-Tenants desires to engage West Medway II as Shared Facilities Manager to provide day-to-day, routine operation and maintenance service for the Shared Facilities and West Medway II desires to provide such services for the in accordance with the terms hereof; and WHEREAS, the Parties are not agreeing to provide any FERC-jurisdictional interconnection or transmission service to each other pursuant to this Agreement and rather shall receive such services as they may be provided from NSTAR Electric Company("Transmission Owner") and/or Transmission Provider pursuant to separate interconnection agreements, as appropriate; AGREEMENT NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing and of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, each of the Co-Tenants hereby agrees as follows: ARTICLE I DEFINITIONS The following capitalized terms will have the respective meanings set forth below: "Affiliate" of a Person means a Person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, such Person. As used in this definition, "control" (including, with its correlative meanings, "controlled by" and "under common control with") shall mean possession, directly or indirectly, of power to direct or cause the direction of management or policies (whether through ownership of securities or partnership or other ownership interests, by contract or otherwise). "Agreement" means this Shared Interconnection Facilities Agreement, as amended from time to time. "Approved Credit Support" means credit support acceptable to West Medway II for the ongoing payment obligations under this Agreement and which may include a guaranty from a creditworthy Affiliate of West Medway. "Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget" has the meaning set forth in Section 6.7(a). "Bankruptcy Event" means, with respect to any Party, such Co-Tenant: (a) voluntarily files a petition or otherwise commences, authorizes or acquiesces in the commencement of a proceeding or cause of action under any bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or similar law, or has any such petition filed or commenced against it by its creditors and such petition is not dismissed within sixty (60) days of the filing or commencement or an order for relief is entered; (b) makes an assignment or any general arrangement for the benefit of creditors; (c) otherwise becomes insolvent, however evidenced; (d) has a liquidator, administrator, receiver, trustee, conservator or similar official appointed with respect to it or any substantial portion of its property or assets; or (e) is generally unable to pay its debts as they fall due. "Construction Start Date" means, for any Project, the date on which the Co-Tenant has delivered a full notice to proceed under its EPC contract to start construction of the Project. "Co-Tenant" means each West Medway and West Medway II acting in its capacity as tenant in common in the Shared Facilities. "Default Rate" means Prime Rate plus three percent (3%) per annum. "Demand" has the meaning set forth in Section 7.3. "Demanding Co-Tenant" has the meaning set forth in Section 7.3. "Directly Assigned Expenses" has the meaning set forth in Section 6.2. "Emergency" shall mean any occurrence, in the reasonable judgment of a Co-Tenant, that may arise that requires immediate action and (i) which constitutes a serious actual or potential hazard to the safety of persons or property, or (ii) may materially interfere with the safe, reliable, economical or environmentally sound operation of the Shared Facilities. "Event of Default" has the meaning set forth in Section 9.1. "Execution Date" has the meaning set forth in the Preamble. "FERC" means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and any successor agency. "GDPIPD" shall mean the implicit price deflator for the gross domestic product as computed and published by the U.S. Department of Commerce. The figures to be used in this adjustment shall be those presented in the "Gross Domestic Product: Third Quarter 'Final' Press Release" typically released in December of each calendar year by the United States Department of Commerce, Bureau of Economic Analysis. No subsequent revisions released by the United States Department of Commerce to those figures will be considered to affect or adjust the Inflation Adjustment Factor. "Generator Interconnection Agreements" means (1) that certain Interconnection and Operation Agreement made and entered into as of December 10, 1997, by and between West Medway (as successor in interest to Sithe Energies, Inc.) and Transmission Owner (then known as Boston Edison Company), as amended, relating to interconnection of Jet 3 and (2) the Standard Large Generator Interconnection Agreement to be entered into by and among West Medway II, Transmission Owner and Transmission Provider with respect to the West Medway II Project ("West Medway II Interconnection Agreement"). "Governmental Authority" means any federal, state, local or other governmental, judicial, public or statutory instrumentality, tribunal, agency, authority, body or entity, or any political subdivision thereof or any regional transmission authority, having legal jurisdiction over the matter or person in question, and specifically includes the North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) and regional electric reliability councils. "Indemnified Co-Tenant" has the meaning set forth in Section 4.1. "Indemnifying Co-Tenant" has the meaning set forth in Section 4.1. "Inflation Adjustment Factor" shall mean a fraction, the numerator of which is the GDPIPD for the next prior calendar year and the denominator of which is the GDPIPD for the prior calendar year; provided that such fraction shall be converted to decimal format to be carried to five (5) decimal places. "Jet 3" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals. "Laws" means all applicable laws, statutes, ordinances, rules, regulations, decrees, policies, orders, permits, requirements, judgments, decisions, injunctions and findings of or issued by any Governmental Authority, including laws relating to health, safety and the environment. "Losses" has the meaning set forth in Section 4.1. "Market Participant" has the meaning set forth in Section 5.5(a)(vi). "NERC Reliability Standards" the reliability standards promulgated by the North American Electric Reliability Corporation and approved by FERC, as such may be amended from time to time. "Non-Pledging Co-Tenant" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.2(b). "Person" means any individual, partnership, joint venture, company, corporation, limited liability company, limited duration company, limited life company, association, trust or other entity or organization, including a government or political subdivision or an agency or instrumentality thereof. "Pledging Co-Tenant" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.2(b). "Point of Interconnection" means the Point of Interconnection identified in the Generator Interconnection Agreement of the applicable Project, as the context requires. "Prime Rate" means the rate of interest per annum publicly announced from time to time by JPMorgan Chase & Co. as its prime lending rate in effect at its principal office in New York City. "Premises Agreement" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals. "Project" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals. "Project Controlled Assets" means, for each Project, the facilities that are part of the Project but are not Shared Facilities. "Pro Rata Share" means, for each Co-Tenant, the percentage interest of such Co-Tenant in the Shared Expenses, calculated from time to time, equal to a fraction, the numerator of which for each Co-Tenant will be the aggregate installed capacity of such Co-Tenant's Project, and the denominator of which will be the aggregate installed capacity of all the Co-Tenants' Projects that own an interest in the Shared Facilities, except that during the period from and after a Co-Tenant's acquisition of an Undivided Interest until installation of such Co-Tenant's Project, the numerator shall be, for such Co-Tenant, the aggregate expected capacity of such Co-Tenant's Project and the denominator shall be the sum of (a) the aggregate installed capacity of all of the Co-Tenants' installed Projects and (b) the aggregate expected capacity of all of the Co-Tenants' Projects that have not achieved installation. "Prudent Industry Practices" shall mean those practices, methods and acts that would be implemented and followed by a prudent operator of generating facilities similar to the Projects in the United States during the relevant time period, which practices, methods and acts, in the exercise of prudent and responsible professional judgment in the light of the facts known at the time the decision was made, could reasonably have been expected to accomplish the desired result consistent with good business practices, reliability and safety. In determining which practices, methods and acts constitute Prudent Industry Practices, due regard shall be given to, among other things, manufacturers' warranties, contractual obligations, the requirements or guidance of Governmental Authorities and the Transmission Provider, applicable Laws, and the requirements of insurers, but in no event shall Prudent Industry Practices be interpreted to require any practice, method or act that violates applicable Laws. "Related Parties" shall mean, in the case of any Person, the partners, members, managers, officers, directors, employees, contractors, attorneys, financial advisors, agents and other advisors or representatives of such Person. "Rules" has the meaning set forth in Section 7.3. "Secured Co-Tenant" shall mean, with respect to a Co-Tenant, (i) a collateral agent or lead bank or lending institution under a loan agreement or indenture with a Co-Tenant or other entity secured by any of the Shared Facilities, or all or a portion of such Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest, (ii) the "owner lessor" or other entity acquiring a Project or undivided ownership interest therein pursuant to a lease financing, (iii) any other entity providing financing for a Project, including through tax equity financing, (iv) any other party acknowledged by such Co-Tenant as a Secured Party in writing; provided, however, that no party shall be deemed a "Secured Party" entitled to the rights accruing to a Secured Party until such party gives written notice to each of the Co-Tenants along with an address for receipt of notices. "Shared Expenses" has the meaning set forth in Section 6.1. "Shared Facilities" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals. "Shared Facilities Manager" means the Person appointed manager of the Shared Facilities, which Person shall perform the obligations of Shared Facilities Manager as set forth in this Agreement and which Person shall be appointed, removed and replaced in accordance with Section 5.2 of this Agreement. The initial Shared Facilities Manager shall be West Medway II. "Shared Facilities Manager Fee" has the meaning set forth in Section 6.1. "Shared Facilities O&M Budget" has the meaning set forth in Section 6.7(a). "Shared Facilities Operating Manual" has the meaning set forth in Section 5.5(c). "Surrendering Co-Tenant" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.3. "Term" has the meaning set forth in ARTICLE III. "Transfer" means to sell, transfer, assign, set over, deliver, convey, dispose of or otherwise demise an interest in tangible assets or intangible property, including this Agreement. "Transfer Effective Date" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.1. "Transmission Owner" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals and any successor thereto. "Transmission Provider" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals and any successor thereto. "Undivided Interest" means, for each Co-Tenant, such Co-Tenant's undivided interest as tenant in common in all rights, title and interest in and to the Shared Facilities. "West Medway" has the meaning set forth in the Preamble. "West Medway II" has the meaning set forth in the Preamble. "West Medway II Project" has the meaning set forth in the Preamble. ARTICLE II CONVEYANCE AND UNDIVIDED INTEREST 2.1 Transfer of Shared Facilities . Pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, West Medway II hereby agrees to Transfer to West Medway an Undivided Interest, as a tenant in common with West Medway II, in and to the Shared Facilities in an amount equal to 16.87% of the Shared Facilities, resulting in West Medway II retaining an Undivided Interest, as a tenant in common with West Medway, in and to the Shared Facilities in an amount equal to 83.13% of the Shared Facilities. On the Execution Date, the Co-Tenants will also execute and deliver a Bill of Sale, substantially in the form attached hereto as Exhibit B ("Bill of Sale"), pursuant to which the Co-Tenants will consummate the Transfers described above effective on the later of (a) the effective date of the Shared Interconnection Facilities Agreement established by FERC or (b) the date construction of the Shared Facilities is sufficiently complete to allow use of the Shared Facilities by Jet 3 but immediately prior to energization of the Shared Facilities (such later date, the "Transfer Effective Date"). Upon the Transfer Effective Date, the Transfers will vest in each of the Co-Tenants' ownership in the Shared Facilities in the amount of their respective Undivided Interests. 2.2 Conveyance; Condition of Property. EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE SET FORTH HEREIN, ALL CONVEYANCES AND TRANSFERS OF THE SHARED FACILITIES MADE PURSUANT TO THIS AGREEMENT ARE MADE "AS IS", "WITH ALL FAULTS" AND WITHOUT WARRANTY, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY WARRANTIES OF QUALITY, MERCHANTABILITY, SUITABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, ANY WARRANTIES REGARDING THE EXISTENCE OF ANY SECURITY INTEREST, LIEN OR ENCUMBRANCE, AND ANY WARRANTIES ARISING BY COMMON LAW, EXCEPT THAT (A) EACH CO-TENANT REPRESENTS AND WARRANTS THAT IT HAS GOOD AND MARKETABLE TITLE TO THE SHARED FACILITIES AND THAT IT IS GRANTING AN INTEREST IN SUCH SHARED FACILITIES UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FREE AND CLEAR OF ALL LIENS, CLAIMS AND ENCUMBRANCES AND (B) EACH CO-TENANT REPRESENTS AND WARRANTS THAT IT HAS THE FULL POWER, RIGHT, AND AUTHORITY TO CONVEY ANY SHARED FACILITIES CONVEYED HEREUNDER. 2.3 Surrender and Assignment . A Co-Tenant who abandons or decommissions its Project shall convey its Undivided Interest and assign its rights hereunder to the other Co-Tenant at no cost or expense to the other Co-Tenant and, thereupon, cease to have any right, title or interest in its Undivided Interest (such Co-Tenant, a "Surrendering Co-Tenant"). The Surrendering Co-Tenant must (a) deliver all instruments of transfer as may be necessary or appropriate to effect the conveyance of its Undivided Interest and assignment of its rights hereunder to, and which are reasonably satisfactory to, the remaining Co-Tenant; (b) assign and convey to the remaining Co-Tenant all its rights under this Agreement, provided, however, that any such surrender of an encumbered Undivided Interest may only be surrendered upon (i) the written consent of each Secured Party that holds a security interest in such Undivided Interest and a release of such Secured Party's security interest being provided by such Secured Party; (ii) receipt of any necessary governmental approvals; and (c) cure of all Events of Default then existing on the part of the Surrendering Co-Tenant. The surrender of its Undivided Interest shall not relieve the Surrendering Co-Tenant of any of its obligations under this Agreement or any other agreement entered into pursuant to this Agreement, unless expressly provided for in this Agreement, or in a writing between the Co-Tenants. ARTICLE III TERM The term of this Agreement ("Term") will commence on the Execution Date, and, unless sooner terminated by mutual agreement of all Parties, will continue as to each Co-Tenant until the end of the commercial life of such Co-Tenant's Project and as to the Shared Facility Manager until it resigns or is removed in accordance with Section 5.2; provided, however, the Term shall in no event exceed fifty (50) years from the Execution Date. ARTICLE IV INDEMNITY, USE AND COMPLIANCE 4.1 Cross Indemnity . Each Co-Tenant (an "Indemnifying Co-Tenant") shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless each of the other Co-Tenants and their respective Affiliates (excluding the relevant indemnitor, as applicable) and all of their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, partners, shareholders and representatives (an "Indemnified Co-Tenant") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, claims, judgments, liens, penalties, costs and expenses, including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' and consultants' fees (collectively, "Losses"), which may be imposed upon or incurred by such Indemnified Co-Tenant or asserted against such Indemnified Co-Tenant by any third person or entity (a) in connection with a breach of this Agreement, failure to comply in any material respect with applicable Law, or any grossly negligent or willful acts or omissions of or on behalf of the Indemnifying Co-Tenant on or with respect to such Co-Tenant's Project Controlled Assets at any time after the Execution Date, except to the extent caused by the Indemnified Co-Tenant's gross negligence or willful misconduct, or (b) as a result of outages or curtailment of the Shared Facilities, other than in accordance with Section 5.5, proximately caused by the Indemnifying Co-Tenant. 4.2 Indemnification of Shared Facilities Manager . Each Co-Tenant shall jointly and severally, indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Shared Facilities Manager and its Affiliates (excluding the relevant indemnitor, as applicable) and all of their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, partners, shareholders and representatives, from and against any and all Losses arising out of (i) the acts (or failures to act) of any such Co-Tenant or its officers, directors, employees, agents, members and representatives, hereunder or (ii) subject to Section 4.3, the acts of the Shared Facilities Manager pursuant to its authority under this Agreement, provided the liability of each Co-Tenant under this subsection (ii) shall be in proportion to such Co-Tenant's Pro Rata Share of such liability; and the Shared Facilities Manager, its owners, officers, directors and employees shall not be liable to the Co-Tenants or any third party for any obligation, liability, or commitment incurred by or on behalf of the Co-Tenants in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement; provided, however, that the Shared Facilities Manager, its officers, directors and employees shall not be entitled to indemnification hereunder to the extent any action, claim, demand, cost or liability results from breach of this Agreement or from the Shared Facilities Manager's gross negligence or willful misconduct. 4.3 Indemnification by the Shared Facilities Manager . The Shared Facilities Manager shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless each Co-Tenant and the Affiliates of each Co-Tenant (other than the Shared Facilities Manager), and all of their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, partners, shareholders and representatives, from and against any and all Losses arising out of the Shared Facilities Manager's gross negligence or willful misconduct. 4.4 Limitations on Liability; Waiver of Consequential Damages . The maximum aggregate liability of a Co-Tenant for Losses under this Agreement shall not exceed an amount equal to the undepreciated cost of the Shared Facilities, and the maximum aggregate liability of the Shared Facilities Manager at any time shall not exceeds an amount equal to the amount of the Shared Facilities Manager Fee received by the Shared Facilities Manager in the immediately preceding year. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, none of the Co-Tenants shall be entitled to, and each Co-Tenant hereby waives any and all rights to recover consequential, incidental and punitive or exemplary damages, however arising, whether in contract, in tort or otherwise, under or with respect to any action taken in connection with this Agreement. 4.5 Environmental Compliance . Without limiting the scope of each Co-Tenant's obligations under Section 4.1, each Co-Tenant will, with respect to such Co-Tenant's Project Controlled Assets, be responsible for all investigations, studies, clean up, corrective actions or responses or remedial actions required by any Governmental Authority now or hereafter authorized to regulate environmental or other matters or by any consent decree or court or administrative order now or hereafter applicable to such Co-Tenant's use, operation or ownership of such Co-Tenant's Project Controlled Assets. Each Co-Tenant will have the right (but not the obligation, unless otherwise required above) to participate in the management and control of all investigations and any environmental clean-up, remediation or related activities relating to such Co-Tenant's Project Controlled Assets. 4.6 No Waste or Nuisance; Maintenance; No Interference. No Co-Tenant will use or permit the use of the Shared Facilities in any manner that would create waste or nuisance that would have a materially adverse effect on any or all of the Shared Facilities, or that would increase the rate or jeopardize the issuance or maintenance of any insurance policy relating to any or all of the Shared Facilities. 4.7 Liens . No Co-Tenant will cause or permit any lien or encumbrance to be levied against or attached to the other Co-Tenants' interests in the Shared Facilities. 4.8 Project Controlled Assets Taxes . Each Co-Tenant will pay all real and personal property taxes and assessments, general or special, levied against such Co-Tenant's Project Controlled Assets. All such taxes and assessments will be paid before delinquency and before any fine, interest or penalty will become due or be imposed for their non-payment. 4.9 Insurance . Each Co-Tenant shall, at its expense, maintain a commercial general liability insurance policy insuring it and the other Co-Tenant for bodily injury and property damage caused by such Co-Tenant's use or operational management, as applicable, of the Shared Facilities, with a limit not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence, accident or incident and an aggregate limit per policy term of not less than Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000). Each Co-Tenant shall, at its expense, maintain an "all-risks" property insurance policy covering the Shared Facilities in an amount equal to the full replacement cost thereof. Certificates of such insurance evidencing the coverages required by this Agreement shall be provided to the other Co-Tenant upon reasonable request. Each Co-Tenant shall have the right to use a qualified program of self-insurance to meet the insurance requirements, and may also provide any such insurance pursuant to one or more blanket insurance policies maintained by such Co-Tenant or its Affiliates. Notwithstanding the requirements above, the Co-Tenants may agree in writing to maintain jointly a general liability insurance policy and/or policy of casualty insurance covering the Shared Facilities in the amounts specified above, with the costs of such jointly maintained policies allocated between the Co-Tenants in accordance with each Co-Tenant's Pro Rata Share. ARTICLE V OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT 5.1 Interconnection Agreement Requirements . During the Term of this Agreement, the Shared Facilities Manager shall be the single point of contact with the Transmission Provider and the Transmission Owner as to all issues affecting the Shared Facilities. All disputes between the Co-Tenants to this Agreement shall be resolved between the Co-Tenants as set forth in Article 7. 5.2 Appointment, Removal and Replacement of Shared Facilities Manager . West Medway II is hereby appointed by the Co-Tenants as the initial Shared Facilities Manager. The Shared Facilities Manager shall hold such position until it (i) resigns for convenience and without any liability to any of the Co-Tenants upon at least ninety (90) days prior written notice to the Co-Tenants, (ii) is removed for convenience upon at least ninety (90) days written notice to the Shared Facilities Manager by either Co-Tenant, or (iii) is removed for cause in the event of any bad faith, gross negligence, recklessness or willful misconduct in connection with performance of its duties hereunder upon notice from either Co-Tenant. Upon any such resignation or removal, the Co-Tenants shall appoint by mutual agreement a new Shared Facilities Manager that is experienced and qualified to perform the duties of the Shared Facilities Manager set forth herein. The Shared Facilities Manager shall, in good faith, continue to undertake its duties and obligations as the Shared Facilities Manager until such time as a successor Shared Facilities Manager is appointed hereunder and accedes to its responsibilities under this Agreement. 5.3 Maintenance of the Shared Facilities . The Shared Facilities Manager agrees to perform and provide with respect to the Shared Facilities professional, supervisory, managerial, administrative and operational responsibilities in accordance with the standards set forth in Section 5.4. The Shared Facilities Manager shall be responsible for compliance with any NERC Reliability Standards applicable to the Shared Facilities. For the avoidance of doubt, each Co-Tenant shall be individually responsible for compliance with NERC Reliability Standards applicable to the Projects except with respect to the Shared Facilities. 5.4 Performance Standard . Subject to the limitations or restrictions set forth in this Agreement, each Co-Tenant shall perform its respective obligations (i) in accordance with this Agreement, (ii) in compliance with all Laws, and (iii) in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices. Without limiting the foregoing, each Co-Tenant shall operate and maintain its Project Controlled Assets acting as a prudent operator and manager and otherwise (a) in accordance with any applicable generator interconnection agreement, any applicable power purchase agreement, any financing agreement or other material agreement relating to such Co-Tenant's Project, and (b) without causing a material adverse effect on the other Co-Tenants unless otherwise agreed between or among the Co-Tenants. Each Co-Tenant and the Shared Facilities Manager shall, to the fullest extent commercially reasonable and subject to Prudent Industry Practices, (x) limit any interference with the use and enjoyment by the other Co-Tenants of its rights in and to the Shared Facilities, and (y) except in the event of an Emergency or as otherwise agreed between the Co-Tenants with respect to planned outages, (A) schedule during an off-peak period any required disconnection of the Shared Facilities or a Co-Tenant's Project to conduct maintenance and repair activities in order to minimize the impact on the Projects of the other Co-Tenants, and (B) provide prior written notice to the other Co-Tenants of commencement of such maintenance and repair activities together with a reasonably detailed description thereof, including dates and times of such maintenance and repair activities, and any anticipated disconnection. The duties to be performed by the Shared Facilities Manager as set forth herein shall not constitute the Shared Facilities Manager as an architect, engineer, or construction contractor, nor impose upon the Shared Facilities Manager any obligation to assume, render to, or perform on behalf of any of the Co-Tenants any responsibilities, duties, services, or activities assumed or rendered by any architect, engineer, or construction contractor employed on any project nor impose upon the party any liability with respect thereto. 5.5 Coordination . (a) Curtailment . (i) Each Co-Tenant shall comply with Section 5.9 with respect to Transmission Provider market directives, including curtailment. (ii) The Co-Tenants shall interrupt or reduce deliveries of electrical power over the Shared Facilities if necessary to do so: (A) in order to maintain, repair, replace, remove, investigate, inspect or test any part of the Shared Facilities or Projects in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, after reasonable notice to and agreement by the Co-Tenants as to the timing and duration of the curtailment; (B) due to an Emergency; or (C) if the Shared Facilities Manager and/or any Co-Tenant is ordered to do so by Transmission Provider other than through routine market dispatch signals, any Governmental Authority or regulatory authority with jurisdiction over the Projects or the Shared Facilities. Curtailment pursuant to Section 5.5(a)(ii)(C) shall be referred to herein as "Directed Curtailment". (iii) The Co-Tenants shall limit the length of any interruption or curtailment pursuant to Section 5.5(a)(ii) to that time strictly necessary to correct the problem or comply with the applicable Interconnection Agreement. Any interruption or curtailment pursuant to Section 5.5(a)(ii)(A) shall be made to the extent commercially reasonable during periods of low energy prices so as to minimize potential loss of revenue of the Co-Tenants(s) being curtailed. (iv) In the event of a Directed Curtailment, the Shared Facilities Manager shall determine and communicate to the Co-Tenants or their respective agents the appropriate reduction for each Co-Tenant, and each Co-Tenant shall comply with such instructions. The Shared Facilities Manager shall determine such instructions based on the Directed Curtailment Plan included in the most recent Shared Facilities Operating Manual. (v) The Shared Facilities Manager shall document the calculations relating to any curtailment described above and upon request from a Co-Tenant, the Shared Facilities Manager shall provide such Co-Tenant with documentation evidencing such calculations. (vi) To implement Directed Curtailments in the amounts determined pursuant to Section 5.5(a)(iv), the Shared Facilities Manager shall have the right and discretion to take the following actions: (A) call each Co-Tenant's designated agent for transacting in the markets administered by Transmission Provider or any other markets for the wholesale sale of energy, capacity and associated products ("Market Participant") and direct them to curtail the allocated amount of curtailment for that Project, or (B) override the maximum output signal being sent to each Co-Tenant's Project with the calculated and allocated cap for that Project. If reduction in output as directed under either (A) or (B) above does not commence within five (5) minutes of the occurrence of (A) or (B), as applicable, or Emergency conditions otherwise require, the Shared Facilities Manager shall have the option to operate such Project's main circuit breaker to take such Project off-line. (vii) In the event that a Project's output exceeds either (A) applicable curtailment signals, or (B) the then maximum output consistent with dispatch requirements by more than 10 MWs in any rolling sequence of four (4) consecutive 5-minute dispatch intervals, then the Shared Facilities Manager shall have the authority to call the Co-Tenant's Market Participant and direct them to reduce output to the appropriate maximum output. In the event such reduction in output does not commence within five (5) minutes following the Shared Facilities Manager's contact with the Co-Tenant's Market Participant, the Shared Facilities Manager shall have the option to operate such Project's main circuit breaker to take such Project off-line. (b) Data . The real time telemetry data that each Co-Tenant and/or its Market Participant provides to the Shared Facility Manager may include, if requested by Shared Facilities Manager, information including but not limited to each Project's dispatch interval forecast of net output and dispatch signal. (c) Shared Facilities Operating Manual . The Co-Tenants shall adopt an operating manual ("Shared Facilities Operating Manual"), which may be updated from time to time by the Shared Facilities Manager, subject to the written approval of all of the other Co-Tenants, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. The Shared Facilities Operating Manual shall provide protocols and specifications relating to the Shared Facilities and the Projects, including without limitation, the following: (i) Specifications for metering and telecommunications schemes and protocols, including compensation algorithms to account for losses at the Point of Interconnection (provided such specifications are consistent with all applicable interconnection agreements). (ii) The Co-Tenants will coordinate the purchase of any required station power. (iii) Each Co-Tenant shall be liable for the costs of measured auxiliary power usage by such Co-Tenant's Project. (iv) A plan for allocating Directed Curtailments (the "Directed Curtailment Plan"), which shall be determined consistent with the following principles: maximization of overall revenue, administrative ease for the Shared Facilities Manager, and a sharing of revenue received during the Directed Curtailment in accordance with an allocation based on the Pro Rata Share) provided that an individual Project's share should be capped at the amount such Project would have received had there been no Directed Curtailment. (v) Any other items as may become necessary from time to time for the efficient operation and management of the Shared Facilities. 5.6 Disconnection from Shared Facilities . A Project shall be disconnected from the Shared Facilities if disconnection is necessary for safety in order to perform maintenance to any portion of the Shared Facilities or in the event of an Emergency. No Co-Tenant shall be liable to any other Co-Tenant for lost production or revenue that occurs as a result of any disconnection or outage of the Shared Facilities in accordance with this Section 5.6. 5.7 Specific Authority . Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, and subject to the limitations of authority of the Shared Facilities Manager in Section 5.8 below or otherwise set forth in this Agreement, in addition to the authority otherwise granted herein, the Shared Facilities Manager shall have the power, without further consent or approval of the other Co-Tenants, to do any of the following: (a) to negotiate, enter into on behalf of the Co-Tenants, and administer agreements with third party contractors, or to employ persons, and to otherwise expend monies necessary for the management, operation, maintenance, and repair of the Shared Facilities in accordance with this Agreement; provided, however, that (i) such engagement and any fees paid to such third party contractor thereunder shall be in accordance with the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget, (ii) with respect to any agreement with a third party contractor that is an Affiliate of the Shared Facilities Manager, the Shared Facilities Manager enters into such agreement on an arms-length basis and (other than with respect to agreements the aggregate value of which does not exceed Two Hundred Thousand Dollars $200,000 during the Term hereof) with the prior written consent of all Co-Tenants, (iii) no such third party contractor engagement shall relieve the Shared Facilities Manager of its rights or obligations set forth in this Agreement, and (iv) any such agreements or other actions shall comply with all applicable financing documents; (b) to pay and collect on behalf of the Co-Tenants amounts due in connection with the Shared Facilities, but only in accordance with the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget; (c) to commit to the expenditure of or spend up to and including Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000) in the aggregate (including the costs of installation and expediting fees) for and on behalf of the Co-Tenants to repair the Shared Facilities due to an Emergency; provided that the Shared Facilities Manager gives concurrent notice by facsimile and electronic mail to the Co-Tenants benefiting from such Shared Facilities regarding the nature and amount of the expenditure as soon as reasonably practicable after the estimated amount of the expenditure is known by the Shared Facilities Manager, but in any event no later than the time the Shared Facilities Manager commits to the expenditure; (d) to negotiate with, and represent the Co-Tenants' interests before, any Governmental Authority regarding property valuation and real property taxes (if any) related to Shared Facilities; provided that any agreements or settlements with respect to the foregoing are approved by the Co-Tenants; and (e) to execute, acknowledge, and deliver any and all instruments and take such other steps as are reasonably necessary to effectuate the foregoing and as are consistent with the terms of this Agreement, including Section 5.8 and any other limitations set forth herein. 5.8 Limitation on Authority . The Shared Facilities Manager shall not take any of the following actions without the prior written approval of all Co-Tenants with a beneficial interest affected by the action: (a) create or cause to be created any lien on any of the Shared Facilities; (b) amend or modify the terms of this Agreement, or any other agreement that affects any Co-Tenant's rights hereunder to develop, own and operate its Project; (c) sell, assign, mortgage, encumber, convey or otherwise transfer all or any portion of the Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest, or any components of the Shared Facilities; (d) borrow funds or otherwise incur indebtedness on behalf of a Co-Tenant; (e) procure any insurance coverage that is less than the coverages required by this Agreement; (f) commit to expenditures in excess of Two Hundred Thousand Dollars ($200,000) per calendar year for each Co-Tenant or Six Hundred Thousand Dollars ($600,000) per calendar year in the aggregate for and on behalf of the Co-Tenants except for repairs to the Shared Facilities due to an Emergency; (g) incur an expense of more than One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000) in any single instance or cumulative expenses of more than Two Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars ($250,000) in the aggregate in any calendar year that is not included in the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget; (h) adopt or amend or modify the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget; (i) make any offer or enter into any contract, letter of intent or agreement with respect to the zoning classification or other zoning or land use restrictions on behalf of the Co-Tenants; or (j) do any act that is specified as being beyond the authority of a Co-Tenant under this Agreement, or in contravention of, or that will otherwise cause a Co-Tenant to be in default under this Agreement. All performance by the Shared Facilities Manager in relation to the Shared Facilities will constitute the performance by the applicable Co-Tenant of such Co-Tenant's obligations under this Agreement relating thereto; provided, however, that upon the default by the Shared Facilities Manager of any such obligation, the applicable Co-Tenant will remain obligated to perform such obligation. 5.9 Market Operations. (a) Each Co-Tenant shall be required to appoint its own Market Participant, and that Market Participant shall be responsible for all schedule coordination and communication telemetry with the Transmission Owner and the Transmission Provider related to scheduling, provided that the Co-Tenants agree to follow all Directed Curtailment instructions. (b) Separate Commercial Pricing Nodes in the Transmission Provider's market model shall be established for each of the Projects and each Project will be responsible for offering its Project into the market, for settlement of cleared energy sales, and for responding separately to the Transmission Provider's dispatch instructions. 5.10 No Jurisdictional Service The Co-Tenants acknowledge that none of the Co-Tenants are providing interconnection or transmission service, and rather that the Co-Tenants are receiving interconnection service under the Generator Interconnection Agreements, and that the Co-Tenants can obtain transmission service, if desired, from the Transmission Owner and the Transmission Provider. ARTICLE VI SHARED EXPENSES; PAYMENTS; O&M BUDGET 6.1 Shared Expenses . Each Co-Tenant shall be responsible for and shall pay its Pro Rata Share of the expenses and liabilities relating to the use, maintenance, repair, and inspection of the Shared Facilities in which it has an interest (the "Shared Expenses"). Shared Expenses do not include Directly Assigned Expenses. Upon becoming a Co-Tenant and until such Co-Tenant ceases to be a Co-Tenant hereunder, the Co-Tenants shall reimburse the Shared Facilities Manager for all reasonable direct and indirect labor and out-of-pocket expenses including, but not limited to, travel, telephone, facsimile, and postage of the Shared Facilities Manager, payable monthly in arrears, including overhead expenses. Such Shared Expenses will be included in the Shared Facilities O&M Budget pursuant to Section 6.8. In addition, the Shared Facilities Manager may charge an aggregate monthly fixed fee in an amount not to exceed Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000) payable by the Co-Tenants based on their respective Pro Rata Share ("Shared Facilities Manager Fee"). Each Co-Tenant shall be liable for its Pro Rata Share of any fees due to landowners relating to the Shared Facilities. Each Co-Tenant shall be solely responsible for any costs incurred under such Co-Tenant's Generator Interconnection Agreement and such costs shall not be included in Shared Expenses. 6.2 Directly Assigned Expenses . Notwithstanding the provisions of this Article 6, any costs, claims, losses or other liabilities exclusively attributable to a particular Co-Tenant may be directly assigned for one hundred percent (100%) cost responsibility of that Co-Tenant ("Directly Assigned Expenses"). 6.3 Expenses Beyond the Scope of this Agreement . The Co-Tenants acknowledge and agree that the costs and expenses that may arise with respect to construction and operation or required amendments to this Agreement caused by a non-Co-Tenant seeking use of any of the Shared Facilities shall be borne by and be the sole responsibility of such non-Co-Tenant. 6.4 Invoicing, Late Payments . The Shared Facilities Manager shall deliver a detailed invoice to the Co-Tenants for their respective Pro Rata Share of the applicable Shared Expenses and any Directly Assigned Expenses on a monthly basis, on or before the tenth (10th) day of each month, for the expected amount to be incurred for all Shared Expenses under Section 6.1 for the immediately following month. The invoice for the following month will true-up, through a charge or credit as applicable, the amount paid on the prior month's invoice to actual Shared Expenses incurred in the immediately prior month. The Co-Tenants shall pay to the Shared Facilities Manager the amount of each invoice within thirty (30) days after the date of the Shared Facilities Manager's issuance of each such invoice. If a Co-Tenant fails to pay all or any portion of any amount owed to the Shared Facilities Manager under this Agreement by its due date for any reason whatsoever, then such Co-Tenant shall, in addition to such unpaid amount, pay interest on the unpaid amount which shall accrue at a rate equal to the Default Rate from the due date therefor until such amount has been paid in full. 6.5 Maintenance of Records . The Shared Facilities Manager shall maintain books and records in sufficient detail to verify amounts due and payable hereunder for a period of not less than three (3) years after the end of the calendar month to which they relate, and all such books and records shall be available for inspection and/or copying by each Co-Tenant and its Secured Parties or its authorized representative at the cost and expense of such party and at reasonable times during regular business hours, upon reasonable notice to the Shared Facilities Manager. 6.6 Quarterly Reports . With respect to each Co-Tenant, following the Construction Start Date of such Co-Tenant's Project, the Shared Facilities Manager shall provide, upon request and no more frequently than quarterly, to each Co-Tenant a report which shall provide each Co-Tenant with such information necessary to keep the Co-Tenants reasonably apprised of the maintenance and repair of the Shared Facilities, including such matters related thereto which may have a material impact on the operation, maintenance or repair of each Co-Tenant's Project. 6.7 Shared Facilities O&M Budget . (a) On or prior to ninety (90) days prior to the beginning of each calendar year during the term hereof, the Shared Facilities Manager shall prepare and submit to the Co-Tenants a proposed budget for the following calendar year for operation, maintenance and repair of the Shared Facilities in accordance with this Agreement (each, a "Shared Facilities O&M Budget"), which shall include, at a minimum, the Shared Facilities Manager Fee, billing rates, estimated cost, based on time and materials and all fees and reimbursable costs contemplated in this Agreement for anticipated operation and maintenance services and repairs to be provided by the Shared Facilities Manager during each month of the following year, including any known Shared Expenses and known Directly Assigned Expenses and any costs and expenses incurred relating to credit support required in connection with any Shared Facilities. The Shared Facilities O&M Budget shall set forth the respective amounts allocated to the Co-Tenants in accordance with their Pro Rata Share. When approved pursuant to subparagraph (b) below, the Shared Facilities O&M Budget shall be the "Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget" for such year. The first Shared Facilities O&M Budget shall be delivered to the Co-Tenants on or before the date that is forty-five (45) days following the Transfer Effective Date, unless otherwise agreed by the Co-Tenants. (b) The Co-Tenants shall give their approval or disapproval of the Shared Facilities O&M Budget no later than thirty (30) days after receipt thereof from the Shared Facilities Manager. If a Co-Tenant objects to all or any portion of the proposed Shared Facilities O&M Budget, the Co-Tenant shall furnish the Shared Facilities Manager and other Co-Tenants in writing, the reasons for such objections and shall immediately commence discussions with the Shared Facilities Manager and the other Co-Tenants in an effort to reach an Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget. Upon such agreement, the Shared Facilities Manager shall revise the Shared Facilities O&M Budget with respect thereto. If the Shared Facilities O&M Budget is approved by all Co-Tenants and the Shared Facilities Manager, the Shared Facilities O&M Budget will be the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget for the following year. If the Co-Tenants and the Shared Facilities Manager are unable to reach an agreement with respect to the Shared Facilities O&M Budget prior to the beginning of the calendar year, the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget for the previous calendar year (or the last Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget if the Shared Facilities O&M Budget for the prior year was not approved), increased per year by the Inflation Adjustment Factor, shall apply; provided, however, that any single extraordinary expense in excess of Twenty Five Thousand Dollars ($25,000) contained in such budget shall not be incurred without the prior approval of all Co-Tenants. 6.8 Shared Facilities Manager Expenses . The Shared Facilities Manager shall be paid or reimbursed, to the extent inconsistent with the Approved Shared Facilities O&M Budget or when such costs exceed the threshold set forth in Section 6.8, as approved in advance by the Co-Tenants, for any unscheduled maintenance and repairs to and replacements of the Shared Facilities performed by the Shared Facilities Manager on behalf of the Co-Tenants at the Shared Facilities Manager's cost, including overhead expenses. Except in the event of an Emergency, the Shared Facilities Manager shall have the right to pre-invoice the Co-Tenants for any materials and components required to be provided hereunder, and not to proceed with the acquisition of such materials and components unless payment has been received by the Shared Facilities Manager for such materials and components. In the event the Shared Facilities Manager does not receive payment for any such pre-invoices, the Shared Facilities Manager may advance its own funds for the purchase of any such materials and components if the Shared Facilities Manager determines it is prudent to do so, and in such event, each Co-Tenant shall promptly, upon receipt of the applicable one or more invoices, deliver to the Shared Facilities Manager an amount equal to its Pro Rata Share of the invoiced amount, plus interest at the Default Rate. 6.9 Other Expenses Caused By Co-Tenants . Notwithstanding the provisions of this Article 6, any costs, claims, losses or other liabilities arising from the actions or inactions of a Co-Tenant in violation or breach of the covenants herein or the provisions of the Premises Agreement, as applicable, shall be the responsibility of such Co-Tenant. ARTICLE VII DISPUTE RESOLUTION 7.1 Dispute Resolution and Procedures . All disputes between or among any of the Co-Tenants shall be resolved in accordance with the dispute resolution procedures set forth in this Article 7. Notwithstanding the foregoing, (a) any Co-Tenant may at any time seek injunctive relief from a court of competent jurisdiction in accordance with Section 9.2(b) of this Agreement, and (b) nothing herein shall prevent any Co-Tenant from defending or pursuing any claim in a court or other proceeding against a third party. 7.2 Notice; Meeting and Confer . In the event a dispute arises regarding the application or interpretation of any provision of this Agreement, the Co-Tenant alleging the dispute shall promptly notify the other Co-Tenants of the dispute in writing. If the Co-Tenants shall have failed to resolve the dispute within ten (10) days after delivery of such written notice, each Co-Tenant shall, within five (5) days of receipt of a written demand from the other Co-Tenant to do so, direct a member of its senior management to confer in good faith within five (5) days with a member of senior management of the other Co-Tenants to resolve the dispute. Should the Co-Tenants be unable to resolve the dispute to their mutual satisfaction within fifteen (15) days, each Co-Tenant shall have the right to pursue the resolution of such dispute in accordance with the provisions of Section 7.3. In no event shall the Transmission Owner or Transmission Provider be asked to resolve a dispute between or among the Co-Tenants. 7.3 Agreement to Arbitrate Disputes . Any controversy, claim or dispute between the Co-Tenants arising out of or related to this Agreement or the breach thereof that cannot be settled pursuant to Section 7.1(a) shall be submitted for arbitration by a single arbitrator in accordance with the provisions contained herein and in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association (the "Rules"). Judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction. The arbitrator shall determine all questions of fact and law relating to any controversy, claim, or dispute hereunder, including but not limited to whether or not any such controversy, claim, or dispute hereunder is subject to the arbitration provisions contained herein.
7.4 Commencement of Proceedings . Any Co-Tenant desiring arbitration (the "Demanding Co-Tenant") shall serve on the other Co-Tenants and its Secured Parties, and the American Arbitration Association in accordance with the Rules, its demand for arbitration (the "Demand"), accompanied by the name of the person chosen by the Demanding Co-Tenant to select an arbitrator. The other Co-Tenants shall choose a person to select an arbitrator, and the persons so chosen shall select the arbitrator. If the Co-Tenant upon whom the Demand is served fails to choose a person to select an arbitrator and advise the Demanding Co-Tenant of its selection within fifteen (15) days after receipt of the Demand, the person chosen by the Demanding Co-Tenant shall select the arbitrator. If the persons chosen by the Co-Tenants to select the arbitrator cannot agree upon an arbitrator within ten (10) days after the designation of the second person, the arbitrator shall be selected in accordance with the Rules. The arbitration proceedings provided hereunder are hereby declared to be self-executing, and it shall not be necessary to petition a court to compel arbitration. 7.5 Location . All arbitration proceedings shall be held in Norfolk County, Massachusetts or such other location as mutually agreed upon by the Co-Tenants. 7.6 Filing Deadlines . Notice of the Demand shall be filed in writing with the other Co-Tenants and with the American Arbitration Association. The Demand shall be made within a reasonable time after the claim, dispute or other matter in question has arisen, and in no event shall it be made after the date when institution of legal or equitable proceedings based on such claim, dispute or other matter in question would be barred by the applicable statutes of limitations. 7.7 Consent to Jurisdiction; Waiver of Jury Trial . Each Co-Tenant irrevocably and unconditionally (a) agrees that any suit, action or other legal proceeding based upon, arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be brought in the state or federal courts located in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts (or, only if the state or federal courts located in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts decline to accept jurisdiction over a particular matter, any state or federal court within the Commonwealth of Massachusetts) (b) consents to the jurisdiction of any such court in any such suit, action or proceeding, and (c) waives any objection that such Co-Tenant may have to the laying of venue of any such suit, action or proceeding in any such court. EACH CO-TENANT AND THE SHARED FACILITIES MANAGER KNOWINGLY, VOLUNTARILY AND IRREVOCABLY WAIVES ANY RIGHT THAT SUCH CO-TENANT OR SHARED FACILITIES MANAGER MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT OF ANY CLAIM BASED UPON, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT. ARTICLE VIII TRANSFER OF INTERESTS; RIGHT TO ENCUMBER 8.1 Transfer . No Co-Tenant to this Agreement may Transfer such Co-Tenant's interest in this Agreement without the consent of all other Co-Tenants to this Agreement; provided, however, consent from the other Co-Tenants to this Agreement shall not be required in the event of a Transfer by a Co-Tenant of all or part of any Project Controlled Asset if, as conditions to the Transfer, (i) the new owner will be assigned and will assume the Transferring Co-Tenant's interest in this Agreement, in whole or in part according to whether the Transfer was total or partial, (ii) the new owner will become a Co-Tenant to this Agreement and will assume in writing for the benefit of all other Co-Tenants (including the Shared Facilities Manager) all existing and future rights, liabilities and obligations of the Transferring Co-Tenant, (iii) the new owner will, immediately following such Transfer, have creditworthiness that is equal to or greater than the Approved Creditworthiness or have provided Approved Credit Support, and provided, further, however, any such Transfer shall be subject to receipt of any required regulatory approvals. Each Co-Tenant may collaterally assign such Co-Tenant's interest in this Agreement and the Shared Facilities to lenders as it sees fit, provided the Project Controlled Asset is collaterally assigned concurrently therewith, but no such assignment will subordinate or otherwise adversely affect the rights of the other Co-Tenants in and to this Agreement or the assets covered hereby. 8.2 Right to Encumber . The Shared Facilities Manager and each other Co-Tenant specifically agree that, without obtaining the consent of the other Co-Tenants to this Agreement (i) a Co-Tenant may at any time mortgage, pledge, collaterally assign, encumber, grant a security interest in, or, in the case of a lease financing, assign, its own Undivided Interest and its rights under this Agreement to any Secured Party, and (ii) any Secured Party may exercise its rights under its agreement with the pledging Co-Tenant, including foreclosing, receiving, transferring, conveying or assigning such pledged Undivided Interest; provided that such Secured Party cures all payment defaults of any defaulting Co-Tenant prior to exercising such rights. 8.3 Pledge, Collateral Assignment or Encumbrance . Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, should a Co-Tenant mortgage, pledge, collaterally assign, encumber, grant a security interest in or assign its Undivided Interest and its rights under this Agreement as provided in Section 8.2(a) above, the Co-Tenants (including the Shared Facilities Manager) expressly agree between themselves and for the benefit of any Secured Party that (i) to the extent an amendment of this Agreement requires the assigning Co-Tenant's consent, no such amendment shall be implemented unless the consent of the Secured Parties of such Co-Tenant of which the Co-Tenants have notice is first obtained if required by the relevant financing documents, (ii) upon the occurrence of an Event of Default by a Co-Tenant hereunder, the non-defaulting Co-Tenant declaring the Event of Default shall also provide written notice to the Secured Parties (of which the non-defaulting Co-Tenant has notice) of such Event of Default (and accept the Secured Parties' cure of such Event of Default if applicable), (iii) each Secured Party shall have the same period after receipt of a notice of Event of Default to cure, or cause to be cured, the Event of Default described therein, as is given to the defaulting Co-Tenant, plus, in each instance, the following additional time periods: (A) thirty (30) days in the event of any monetary Event of Default; and (B) sixty (60) days in the event of any non-monetary Event of Default; provided, however, that such sixty (60)-day period shall be extended for the time reasonably required by the Secured Party to complete such cure, so long as the Secured Parties (or any of them) is diligently pursuing such cure and (iv) in case of the conveyance, transfer, assignment or foreclosure of the pledged Undivided Interest or termination of this Agreement or a Co-Tenant's interest in this Agreement as a result of any Event of Default under this Agreement or any agreement with any Secured Party or a Bankruptcy Event of a Co-Tenant (the "Pledging Co-Tenant"), (1) the other Co-Tenant (the "Non-Pledging Co-Tenant") shall, if applicable, give prompt notice of such conveyance, transfer, assignment, foreclosure or termination to the Secured Parties of the Pledging Co-Tenant of which the Non-Pledging Co-Tenant has notice and (2) the Non-Pledging Co-Tenant shall, upon written request of the first priority Secured Party of the Pledging Co-Tenant made within forty (40) days after such written notice to such Secured Party, enter into a new shared facilities agreement with such Secured Party, or its designee or assignee, on the same terms and conditions as this Agreement, or to the extent only the Pledging Co-Tenant's interest is terminated, permit the Secured Party or its designee or assignee to join in this Agreement as a new Co-Tenant in place of the Pledging Co-Tenant, within twenty (20) days after the receipt of such request. Any such new shared facilities agreement shall be effective as of the date of the termination of this Agreement by reason of an Event of Default by the Pledging Co-Tenant, upon the same terms, covenants, conditions and agreements as contained in this Agreement. Upon the execution of any such new shared facilities agreement, the Secured Parties, or their designees or assignees, of the Pledging Co-Tenant shall (x) pay the Non-Pledging Co-Tenant any amounts which are due the Non-Pledging Co-Tenant from the Pledging Co-Tenant under the terms of this Agreement, and (y) agree in writing to perform or cause to be performed all of the other covenants and agreements set forth in this Agreement to be performed by the Pledging Co-Tenant to the extent they accrue following the execution and delivery of the new Agreement. A Secured Party shall only be liable under this Agreement while it is in possession of or is the owner of an Undivided Interest, and only to the extent of its interest in the Pledging Co-Tenant's assets. For the avoidance of doubt, the assignment of a Pledging Co-Tenant's interest to its Secured Parties (or their successors or assigns) shall not require the prior consent of the other Co-Tenants. Notwithstanding any of the foregoing in this Section 8.2(b), to the extent a Co-Tenant has an executed consent or similar agreement in connection with the financing of an assigning Co-Tenant's Project, and the provisions set forth in such consent or similar agreement differ from the provisions set forth in this Section 8.2(b), the provisions set forth in the applicable consent or similar agreement shall control. 8.4 Estoppels; Consents; Etc . In connection with the financing of each Project, each Co-Tenant (including the Shared Facilities Manager) will, upon the reasonable request of a Co-Tenant, provide customary estoppels and consents in favor of lenders or other finance parties, including rights of step-in with respect to a Co-Tenant's obligations under this Agreement and rights to concurrent notice of an Event of Default. Each Co-Tenant shall also reasonably cooperate with the other Co-Tenants in the making of any filings required by such requesting Co-Tenant for regulatory compliance or Laws, and in the operation and maintenance of a requesting Co-Tenant's Project, all solely at the expense of the requesting Co-Tenant. ARTICLE IX DEFAULT AND REMEDIES 9.1 Events of Default; Default . The following shall each constitute a default by a Co-Tenant under this Agreement (an "Event of Default"): (a) failure by a Co-Tenant to pay in full any amount due and payable hereunder when due, or any monetary judgment awarded by a court of competent jurisdiction which is not being appealed within sixty (60) days of such judgment, where such failure is not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice of such failure, provided, however, that such period shall be extended for so long as the defaulting Co-Tenant is disputing in good faith such amount pursuant to the procedures set forth in Article 7; (b) a Bankruptcy Event occurs with respect to such Co-Tenant; (c) a breach, or the cause of a breach, by a Co-Tenant of the Premises Agreement, and a failure to cure such breach within the cure period permitted by the Premises Agreement, as applicable; (d) levy, seizure, assignment or sale of a substantial part of the property of a Co-Tenant for or by any creditor (other than the Secured Parties) or Governmental Authority that materially affects the rights of the other Co-Tenants under this Agreement or the Shared Facilities Manager's ability to perform under this Agreement, but, for the avoidance of doubt, specifically excluding any assignment for, or foreclosures, sales, assignments or transfers in lieu of foreclosure, exercise of other remedies or any other actions undertaken by, a Co-Tenant's Secured Parties; (e) a representation or warranty made by a Co-Tenant under this Agreement was false or misleading in any material respect when made, where the material adverse effects of or relating to such representation or warranty are not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice thereof from one or more non-defaulting Co-Tenants; provided, that if such Co-Tenant has commenced and is diligently pursuing such cure and provides the other Co-Tenants with adequate assurance of due performance, the cure period shall be extended to not more than one hundred eighty (180) days after the written notice of default, as shall be necessary for such Co-Tenant to cure such material adverse effect with all due diligence and dispatch; and (f) a breach by a Co-Tenant in observing or performing any of its material obligations set forth in this Agreement, other than those described in clauses (a) through (e) above; provided such breach is not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice thereof from one or more non-defaulting Co-Tenants; and provided further that if such Co-Tenant has commenced and is diligently pursuing such cure and provides the other Co-Tenants with adequate assurance of due performance, the cure period shall be extended to not more than one hundred eighty (180) days after the written notice of default, as shall be necessary for such Co-Tenant to cure the breach with all due diligence and dispatch. 9.2 Remedies . In addition to all other remedies permitted by Law or equity or under this Agreement (all of which will be cumulative), following an Event of Default: (a) The non-defaulting Co-Tenant and such Co-Tenant's Secured Parties or other interest holders will be entitled following an Event of Default to perform the obligations of the defaulting Co-Tenant, and the defaulting Co-Tenant will reimburse the performing Co-Tenant for its expenses which it incurred in rendering the performance, plus interest at the Default Rate. (b) The Co-Tenants agree that damages may be an inadequate remedy for an Event of Default under this Agreement, and that each Co-Tenant will be entitled to seek injunctive and other equitable relief against the other Co-Tenant to prevent or eliminate such default, or to enforce the provisions of this Agreement. ARTICLE X REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES As of the Execution Date, each Co-Tenant represents and warrants for the benefit of the other Co-Tenants as follows: It is a limited liability company or corporation, duly organized and existing in good standing under the laws of the state of its formation or incorporation, qualified to do business in the State of Delaware, and has the requisite power and authority to enter into this Agreement. This Agreement has been duly authorized and constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligation of it, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms; and the execution and delivery of this Agreement and, except as otherwise set forth herein, performance of its obligations hereunder will not require the approval of any Governmental Authority and will not contravene, conflict with or result in the breach or violation of any document to which it is bound or in any law, rule or regulation. Except as otherwise set forth herein, it possesses all requisite power and authority and required permits, consents and licenses (if any) to perform this Agreement and to carry out the transactions contemplated herein. No suit, action or arbitration, or legal, administrative or other proceeding is pending or, to its knowledge, threatened against it that would affect the validity or enforceability of this Agreement or the ability of it to fulfill its obligations and commitments hereunder. ARTICLE XI GENERAL PROVISIONS 11.1 Notices . Any notices, statements, demands, correspondence or other communications required or permitted to be given hereunder will be in writing and will be given (a) personally, (b) by electronic mail to the e-mail address which is shown beneath each Co-Tenant's signature block to this Agreement or to such other e-mail address as each Co-Tenant shall by notice require or (c) by overnight or other courier or delivery service, freight prepaid, to the recipient Co-Tenant's address shown beneath such Co-Tenant's signature block to this Agreement. Notices delivered by hand will be deemed received when delivered, notices delivered by e-mail will be deemed received on the next day on which the office of the receiving Co-Tenant is normally open for business following the day on which the e-mail is actually received in the intended recipient's inbox in a readable form, and notices sent by overnight or other courier or delivery service will be deemed received on the first to occur of: (i) two (2) business days after deposit in the United States mail or with such overnight or other courier or delivery service, addressed to such address or addresses, (ii) written acceptance of delivery by the recipient or (iii) written rejection of delivery by the recipient. Each Co-Tenant agrees to the use of electronic signatures. 11.2 Third Party Beneficiaries . Except as otherwise provided herein, the covenants contained herein are made solely for the benefit of the Co-Tenants (including the Shared Facilities Manager) and their respective successors and permitted assigns, and will not be construed as having been intended to benefit any person or entity who is not a party to this Agreement. 11.3 Amendment . Any changes to this Agreement shall require the written agreement of all of the Co-Tenants (including the Shared Facilities Manager). 11.4 Integration . This Agreement contains all agreements of the Co-Tenants with respect to the subject matter hereof, and except as otherwise indicated herein, all other prior agreements, understandings, correspondence and negotiations between or among any one or more of the Co-Tenants, whether oral or written, pertaining to the subject matter of this Agreement, will be of no further force or effect, and are superseded hereby. 11.5 Severability . The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision hereof as determined by a court of competent jurisdiction will in no way affect the validity and enforceability of any other provision hereof; and in the event that any part or provision of this Agreement will be determined by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unenforceable, then the remaining portions of this Agreement which can be separated from the invalid, unenforceable provisions will, nevertheless, continue in full force and effect. 11.6 Further Assurances; Cooperation . Each of the Co-Tenants will, from time to time, execute, cause to be acknowledged and deliver such documents or instruments, and provide such certificates, as any other Co-Tenant to this Agreement may reasonably request to carry out and fulfill the transactions, and permit the exercise and performance of the rights and obligations, as are contemplated hereunder. Each of the Co-Tenants will cooperate with each other to effectuate fully the purposes and intent of this Agreement. 11.7 Successors and Assigns . The Shared Facilities will be held, conveyed, assigned, hypothecated, encumbered, leased and used subject to the covenants, terms and provisions set forth in this Agreement, and such covenants, terms and provisions will run with the land, and will be binding upon and inure to the benefit of each of the Co-Tenants and each other person and entity having any interest therein during their ownership thereof, and their respective permitted grantees, heirs, successors and permitted assigns, and will create privity of contract and estate among the Co-Tenants and their respective grantees, heirs, successors and permitted assigns. 11.8 Nature of Relationship Between Co-Tenants . The Co-Tenants hereby declare that the Co-Tenant's relationship in and to the Shared Facilities is and will be that of tenants in common, expressly subject, however, to the terms, conditions, limitations and requirements set forth in this Agreement. Nothing contained in this Agreement will be deemed to constitute the Co-Tenants as partners or joint venturers. 11.9 Waiver of Partition . The Co-Tenants will not have and hereby waive the right to partition all or any portion of the Shared Facilities, or to make application to any court or authority or to commence or prosecute any action or proceeding for partition of the Shared Facilities. Each Co-Tenant will be entitled to a decree or order restraining or enjoining such partition, application, action or proceeding upon any breach of the provisions of this Section 11.10. The Co-Tenants acknowledge and agree that they have been paid full consideration for the waiver herein provided. 11.10 Construction . This Agreement will be subject to, governed by, and construed in accordance with the Laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. This Agreement will be construed equally as between the Co-Tenants hereto, and will not be construed against the Co-Tenant responsible for the drafting of this Agreement. Captions in this Agreement are inserted for convenience of reference only, and do not define, describe or limit the scope or intent of this Agreement or any of the terms hereof. No remedy or election of or by any Co-Tenant hereunder will be deemed exclusive, but will, wherever possible, be cumulative with all other remedies available hereunder, at law or in equity. As used herein, the neuter gender includes the masculine and the feminine, the singular number includes the plural, and vice versa and "including" means "including, but not limited to" and other forms of the verb "to include" are to be interpreted similarly. Time is of the essence with respect to the obligations to be performed under this Agreement. All Exhibits and Schedules attached hereto are hereby incorporated herein by this reference. 11.11 Waiver . The waiver by any Co-Tenant of any covenant contained herein will not be deemed a continuing waiver of such covenant or of any other covenant contained herein, or of any subsequent breach by any other Co-Tenant. No Co-Tenant's acceptance of a payment or performance by any other Co-Tenant will be deemed a waiver of any preceding breach by such other Co-Tenant of any provisions hereof. Any waiver hereunder must be in a writing signed by such waiving Co-Tenant. 11.12 Survival . Any obligations referred to herein to be performed at any time after the expiration or termination of this Agreement, and all indemnities and hold harmless agreements provided herein, will survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement. 11.13 Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when so executed will be deemed an original, and all of which when taken together will constitute one and the same instrument.
